meanings.definition: The quality of being amusing or entertaining.
meanings.sent1: Her jokes always bring a sense of humour to our conversations.
meanings.sent2: The comedian's humour had the audience laughing throughout the show.
meanings.sent3: His witty humour never fails to lighten the mood.
meanings.sent4: The book was filled with humour, making it a delightful read.
meanings.sent5: The clown's colourful costume added to the overall humour of the circus performance.

meanings.definition: The ability to perceive or express humor.
meanings.sent1: She has a great sense of humour and can always find something to laugh about.
meanings.sent2: His humour allows him to connect with people through laughter.
meanings.sent3: Even in difficult situations, his humour shines through.
meanings.sent4: Her quick wit and humour make her a joy to be around.
meanings.sent5: His infectious humour brightens up any room he enters.

meanings.definition: A mood or state of mind.
meanings.sent1: Despite the rainy weather, she was in good humour all day.
meanings.sent2: His cheerful humour lifted everyone's spirits at the party.
meanings.sent3: The playful humour in the air made the event more enjoyable.
meanings.sent4: The peaceful garden filled her with a sense of humour.
meanings.sent5: The holiday season always puts me in a festive humour.
